intro: Cissampelos pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and its fruits are fleshy berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
